<<<<<<< HEAD
Romæ antiquæ notitia, or, The antiquities of Rome in two parts ... : an account of the religion, civil government, and art of war, with the remarkable customs and ceremonies, publick and private : with copper cuts of the principal buildings, &c. : to which are prefix'd two essays : concerning the Roman learning, and the Roman education / by Basil Kennett ... Kennett, Basil, 1674-1715.
[40], 368, [23] p., 10 leaves of plates (4 folded), 1 folded map.
Printed for A. Swall and T. Child ..., London : 1696.
First edition. Index: p. [1]-[22] at end. Errata: p. [23] at end. Includes bibliographical references. Dedicated to His Highness the Duke of Glocester. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library. (from t.p.) I. A short history of the rise, progress, and decay of the common-wealth -- II. A description of the city.
=======
Romæ antiquæ notitia, or, The antiquities of Rome in two parts ... : an account of the religion, civil government, and art of war, with the remarkable customs and ceremonies, publick and private : with copper cuts of the principal buildings, &c. : to which are prefix'd two essays : concerning the Roman learning, and the Roman education / by Basil Kennett ... Kennett, Basil, 1674-1715.
[40], 368, [23] p., 10 leaves of plates (4 folded), 1 folded map.
Printed for A. Swall and T. Child ..., London : 1696.
First edition. Index: p. [1]-[22] at end. Errata: p. [23] at end. Includes bibliographical references. Dedicated to His Highness the Duke of Glocester. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library. (from t.p.) I. A short history of the rise, progress, and decay of the common-wealth -- II. A description of the city.
